turns.speaker: OLD WOMAN
turns.text: Dennis! There's some lovely filth down here ...  Oh! how d'you do?

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: How d'you do, good lady ... I am Arthur, King of the Britons ... can you tell me who lives in that castle?

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: All of us are ... we are all Britons.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Please, please good people.  I am in haste.  What knight lives in that castle?

turns.speaker: OLD WOMAN
turns.text: Order, eh -- who does he think he is?

turns.speaker: OLD WOMAN
turns.text: Well, I didn't vote for you.

turns.speaker: OLD WOMAN
turns.text: Well, how did you become king, then?

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: The Lady of the Lake, her arm clad in the purest shimmering samite, held Excalibur aloft from the bosom of the water to signify by Divine Providence ...  that I, Arthur, was to carry Excalibur ... That is why I am your king! | |                              OLD WOMAN |      Is Frank in?  He'd be able to deal with this one. | DENNIS Look,  strange women lying on their backs in ponds handing out swords ... that's no basis for a system of government.  Supreme executive power derives from a mandate from the masses, not from some farcical aquatic ceremony.

turns.speaker: TALL KNIGHT
turns.text: We are the keepers of the sacred words.  NI ... Peng ... and Neee ... Wom!

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Knights Who Say "Ni" ... we are but simple travellers.  We seek the Enchanter who lives beyond this wood and who ...

turns.speaker: TALL KNIGHT
turns.text: We shall say Ni! again to you if you do not appease us.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: All right!  What do you want?

turns.speaker: TALL KNIGHT
turns.text: Ni!  Ni!  Ni ... Peng ... Nee ... Wum!

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: All right!  All right! ... No more, please.  We will find you a shrubbery ...

turns.speaker: TALL KNIGHT
turns.text: You must return here with a shrubbery or else ...  you shall not pass through this wood alive!

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Thanks you, Knights Who Say Ni!  You are fair and just.  We will return with a shrubbery.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Oh, Knights of Ni, here is your shrubbery.  May we go now?

turns.speaker: TALL KNIGHT
turns.text: That is a good shrubbery.  I like the laurels particularly - But there is one small problem.

turns.speaker: TALL KNIGHT
turns.text: We are now no longer the Knights Who Say Ni!

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: We shall do no such thing ... let us pass!

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Cut down a tree with a herring?  It can't be done!

turns.speaker: TALL KNIGHT
turns.text: I cannot tell you.  Suffice to say is one of the words the Knights of Ni! cannot hear!

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: How can we not say the word, if you don't tell us what it is?

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: I have no quarrel with you, brave Sir knight, but I must cross this bridge.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: I command you, as King of the Britons to stand aside.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Victory is mine.  I thank thee O Lord that in thy ...

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: You are indeed brave Sir knight, but the fight is mine.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: You stupid bastard.  You havn't got any arms left.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: What are you going to do. bleed on me?

turns.speaker: BLACK KNIGHT
turns.text: The Black Knight always triumphs. Have at you!

turns.speaker: BLACK KNIGHT
turns.text: All right, we'll call it a draw.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: I am King Arthur and these are the Knights of the Round Table.  Whose castle is this?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: This is the castle of of my master, Guy de Loimbard.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Please go and tell your master that we have been charged by God with a sacred quest,  and if he will give us food and shelter for this night he can join us in our quest for the Holy Grail.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Well, I'll ask him, but I don't think he'll be very keen. He's already got one, you see?

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Are you sure he's got one?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Oh yes.  It's very nice + +  CUT TO BATTLEMENTS. THE TAUNTER  turns to some others. + +                              MAN +      I told him we already got one. + +  They all giggle. +

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Well ... can we come up and have a look?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Of course not!  You are English pigs.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I'm French.  Why do think I have this outrageous accent, you silly king.

turns.speaker: BEDEVERE
turns.text: Who are you who are so wise in the ways of science?

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: I am Arthur, King of the Britons.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Good Sir knight, will you come with me to Camelot, and join our number at the Round Table?

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Then I dub you ... Sir Bedevere ... Knight of the Round Table!

turns.speaker: BEDEVERE
turns.text: And that, my lord, is how we know the Earth to be banana-shaped.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: This new learning amazes me, Sir Bedevere.  Explain again how sheep's bladders may be employed to prevent earthquakes.

turns.speaker: BEDEVERE
turns.text: Well now, Launcelot, Galahad, and I wait until nightfall and then leap out of the rabbit and take the French by surprise, not only by surprise but totally unarmed!

turns.speaker: BEDEVERE
turns.text: Er ... We ... Launcelot, Galahad, and I ... Er ...  leap out of the rabbit and ...

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Who are you? TALL KNIGHT We are the Knights Who Say "Ni"!

turns.speaker: BEDEVERE
turns.text: No!  Not the Knights Who Say "Ni"!

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: |      It's not working. You're not doing it properly.  Ni!

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Then we'd best leave them here and carry on on foot.

turns.speaker: BEDEVERE
turns.text: It's the ... oh ...  it's the ... it's on the tip of my tongue ...

turns.speaker: BEDEVERE
turns.text: It's The Legendary Black Beast of Aaaaarrrrrrggghhh! | |  At that moment there is a yell and a scream OUT OF VISION.  ARTHUR turns. | |                              ARTHUR |      Who was that? | |                              HECTOR |           |      It was Sir Alf. | |                              ARTHUR |      I didn't know we had a Sir Alf. | |                              HECTOR |      He was feeding it bread. | |                              ARTHUR |           |      Well, that was a very silly thing to do.  Now the rest of you stand |      well back from the BLACK BEAST of Aaaaarrrrrrggghhh! | |                              HECTOR |      Aaaaarrrrrrggghhh! | |                              ROBIN |      Look out. | |  The animation MONSTER starts lumbering towards them.  The KNIGHTS retreat |  into the darkness of the cave. | |                              GAWAIN |           |      It's only a cartoon. | |                              ARTHUR |      Sh!

turns.speaker: BEDEVERE
turns.text: Yes, my liege.  Stand by for attack!!

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: What manner of man are you that can conjure up fire without flint or tinder?

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: By what name are you known?

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: There are some who call me Tim?

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: I do.  You seek the Holy Grail.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: That is our quest.  You know much that is hidden O Tim.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Yes, I can help you with your guest.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: ... make plain the last resting place of the most Holy Grail.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: How shall we find this cave, O Tim?

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: You got us all worked up.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: It's always the same ... if I've said it once.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Ha ha ha.  Ha ha ha.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Man.  I'm sorry.  Old man, What knight live in that castle over there?

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: I didn't know you were called Dennis.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: You didn't bother to find out, did you?

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: I've said I'm sorry about the old woman, but from the behind you looked ...

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: What I object to is that you automatically treat me like an inferior ...

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Oh, very nice. King, eh!  I expect you've got a palace and fine clothes and courtiers and plenty of food.  And how d'you get that? By exploiting the workers! By hanging on to outdated imperialist dogma which perpetuates the social and economic differences in our society!  If there's EVER going to be any progress ...

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: I told you,  We're an anarcho-syndicalist commune,  we take it in turns to act as a sort of executive officer for the week.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: ... But all the decision of that officer ...

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: ... must be approved at a bi-weekly meeting by a simple majority in the case of purely internal affairs.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Be quiet!  I order you to shut up.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: You can't expect to wield supreme executive power just 'cause some watery tart threw a sword at you!

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: I mean, if I went around saying I was an Emperor because some moistened bint had lobbed a scimitar at me, people would put me away!

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Shut up, will you. Shut up!

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Ah! NOW ... we see the violence inherent in the system.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Come and see the violence inherent in the system. Help, help, I'm being repressed!

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Oh, Did you hear that!  What a give-away.

turns.speaker: GOD
turns.text: And don't apologize.  Every time I try to talk to someone it's sorry this and forgive me that and I'm not worthy and ... What are you doing now?

turns.speaker: GOD
turns.text: Well, don't. |      I really don't know where all this got started. It's like those miserable psalms.  they're so depressing. Now knock it of

turns.speaker: GOD
turns.text: Right.  Arthur, King of the Britons, you're Knights of the Round Table shall have a task to make them an example in these dark times ...

turns.speaker: FIRST VILLAGER
turns.text: ... Well, we did do the nose.

turns.speaker: FIRST VILLAGER
turns.text: And the hat.  But she is a witch.

turns.speaker: FIRST VILLAGER
turns.text: ... Um ... Yes ... no ... a bit ... yes... she has got a wart.

turns.speaker: BEDEVERE
turns.text: Why do you think she is a witch?

turns.speaker: FIRST VILLAGER
turns.text: Make a bridge out of her.

turns.speaker: BEDEVERE
turns.text: Ah ... but can you not also make bridges out of stone?

turns.speaker: FIRST VILLAGER
turns.text: If she ... weighs the same as a duck ... she's made of wood.

turns.speaker: LARGE MAN
turns.text: He will be soon. He's very ill.

turns.speaker: LARGE MAN
turns.text: You're not.   You'll be stone dead in a few minutes.

turns.speaker: BODY
turns.text: I think I'll go for a walk.

turns.speaker: LARGE MAN
turns.text: You're not fooling anyone you know.  Isn't there anything you could do?

turns.speaker: BODY
turns.text: I feel happy... I feel happy.

turns.speaker: BRIDGEKEEPER
turns.text: Who approaches the Bridge of Death Must answer me These questions three! Ere the other side he see.

turns.speaker: LAUNCELOT
turns.text: Ask me the questions, Bridgekeeper.  I am not afraid.

turns.speaker: BRIDGEKEEPER
turns.text: Stop! Who approacheth the Bridge of Death Must answer me These questions three! Ere the other side he see!

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Ask me the questions, Bridgekeeper.  I am not afraid.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: My name is Sir Robin of Camelot!

turns.speaker: BRIDGEKEEPER
turns.text: What is the capital of Assyria?

turns.speaker: LARGE MAN
turns.text: Well, can you hang around a couple of minutes.  He won't be long.

turns.speaker: CART DRIVER
turns.text: I promised I'd be at the Robinson's.  They've lost nine today.

turns.speaker: CART DRIVER
turns.text: That's all right.  See you on Thursday.

turns.speaker: CART DRIVER
turns.text: I dunno, Must be a king.

turns.speaker: CART DRIVER
turns.text: He hasn't got shit all over him.

turns.speaker: LAUNCELOT
turns.text: At last!   A call!  A cry of distress ...  Concorde!  Brave, Concorde ... you shall not have died in vain!

turns.speaker: LAUNCELOT
turns.text: Oh, well ... er brave Concorde!  You shall not have been fatally wounded in vain!

turns.speaker: CONCORDE
turns.text: I think I could pull through, sir.

turns.speaker: LAUNCELOT
turns.text: Good Concorde ... stay here and rest awhile.

turns.speaker: CONCORDE
turns.text: I think I'll be all right to come with you, sir.

turns.speaker: LAUNCELOT
turns.text: I will send help, brave friend, as soon as I have accomplished this most daring, desperate adventure in this genre.

turns.speaker: CONCORDE
turns.text: It just seems silly ... me lying here.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Did you kill all those guards?

turns.speaker: LAUNCELOT
turns.text: Well, I'm really am most awfully sorry but I ... I can explain everything ...

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: You killed eight wedding guests in all!

turns.speaker: LAUNCELOT
turns.text: Er, Well ... the thing is ... I thought your son was a lady.

turns.speaker: LAUNCELOT
turns.text: Oh dear, I didn't really mean to...

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Didn't mean to?  You put your sword right through his head!

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: You even kicked the bride in the chest!  It's going to cost me a fortune!

turns.speaker: LAUNCELOT
turns.text: I can explain ...  I was in the forest ... riding north from Camelot ... when I got this note.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: 'Mm ... very nice castle, Camelot ... very good pig country....

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Do you want to come and have a drink?

turns.speaker: LAUNCELOT
turns.text: It's just that when I'm in this genre, I tend to get over-excited and start to leap around and wave my sword about ... and ...

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Oh, don't worry about that ... Tell me ... doesn't Camelot own that stretch of farmland up by the mountains?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: One day, lad, all this will be yours ...

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: No!  Not the curtains, lad ...  All that ...  all that you can see, stretched out over the hills and valleys ... as far as the eye can see and beyond ... that'll be your kingdom, lad.

turns.speaker: PRINCE
turns.text: But, Father, I don't really want any of that.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Listen, lad, I built this kingdom up from nothing.  All I had when I started was swamp ...  other kings said I was daft to build a castle on a swamp, but I built it all the same ... just to show 'em. It sank into the swamp.  So I built a another one ... that sank into the swamp.  I built another one ...  That fell over and THEN sank into the swamp ....  So I built another ... and that stayed up. ... And that's what your gonna get, lad: the most powerful kingdom in this island.

turns.speaker: PRINCE
turns.text: But I don't want any of that, I'd rather ...

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: You're not going to do a song while I'm here!

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Herbert ...  We built this castle on a bloody swamp, we need all the land we can get.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Don't like her?   What's wrong with her?  She's beautiful ... she's rich ... she's got huge tracts of land ...

turns.speaker: PRINCE
turns.text: I know ... but ... I want the girl that I marry to  have ... a certain ... special ... something ...

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Shut your noise, you,  and get that suit on!

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Shut up!  You only killed the bride's father - that's all -

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: You fell out of the Tall Tower you creep!

turns.speaker: PRINCE
turns.text: I was saved at the last minute.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Make sure the Prince doesn't leave this room until I come and get him.

turns.speaker: FIRST GUARD
turns.text: Not ... to leave the room ... even if you come and get him.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: No.  Until I come and get him.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: No ...  You stay in the room and make sure he doesn't leave.

turns.speaker: FIRST GUARD
turns.text: ... and you'll come and get him.

turns.speaker: FIRST GUARD
turns.text: We don't need to do anything, apart from just stop him entering the room.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Look, it's  simple.  Just stay here and make sure he doesn't leave the room.

turns.speaker: FIRST GUARD
turns.text: Oh, I remember ... can he ... er ... can he leave the room with us?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: No ....  keep him in here ... and make sure he doesn't ...

turns.speaker: FIRST GUARD
turns.text: Oh, yes!  we'll keep him in here, obviously.  But if he had to leave and we were with him.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: No ... just keep him in here.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: No, not anyone else - just me.

turns.speaker: FIRST GUARD
turns.text: Okay.  Fine.  We'll remain here until you get back.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: And make sure he doesn't leave.

turns.speaker: FIRST GUARD
turns.text: Oh yes, of course!  I thought you meant him!  You know it seemed a bit daft me havin' to guard him when he's a guard ...

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: No, I want you to stay here and make sure he doesn't leave the room until I get back.

turns.speaker: ZOOT
turns.text: Yes.  It's not a very good name, is it?  But we are nice and we shall attend to your every ... every need!

turns.speaker: GALAHAD
turns.text: Er ... +      You are the keepers of the Holy Grail?

turns.speaker: ZOOT
turns.text: The what?  But you are tired and you must rest awhile.  Midget! Crapper!

turns.speaker: ZOOT
turns.text: What is your name, handsome knight?

turns.speaker: ZOOT
turns.text: Mine is Zoot. Just Zoot  But come.

turns.speaker: GALAHAD
turns.text: Well Look, I'm afraid I really ought to be ...

turns.speaker: ZOOT
turns.text: I'm afraid our life must seem very dull and quiet compared to yours.  We are but eightscore young blondes, all between sixteen and nineteen-and-a-half, cut off in this castle, with no one to protect us.  Oooh.  It is a lonely life ... bathing ... dressing ... undressing ... making exciting underwear....

turns.speaker: ZOOT
turns.text: We are just not used to handsome knights ...  But you are wounded!

turns.speaker: ZOOT
turns.text: You must see the doctors immediately.  You must lie down.

turns.speaker: GALAHAD
turns.text: No, really, I can cope.  I can handle this lot easily!

turns.speaker: LAUNCELOT
turns.text: We were in the nick of time.  You were in great peril.

turns.speaker: LAUNCELOT
turns.text: You were, Sir Galahad, You were in terrible peril.

turns.speaker: GALAHAD
turns.text: Look, let me go back in there and face the peril?

turns.speaker: GALAHAD
turns.text: Look, it's my duty as a knight to try and sample as much peril as I can.

turns.speaker: LAUNCELOT
turns.text: No, no, we must find the Grail.

turns.speaker: GALAHAD
turns.text: Oh, let me go and have a bit of peril?
